WorkItem.Description:
Hi, I been playing around with the CVS writer. I want to create a procedure for importing Excel books into Mysql. Using a script similar to 07reader.php I get  
Excel cell value '2007-10-01' Category=Date Type=2001-03-14 
transforms into  '39356' datatype='n' numberFormat="yyyy/mm/dd;@"
 
I create the Excel with Excel 2007 in a windows XP sp2 via  ftp to a Linux system.
Note the first row contains a header 'date1', ie E1='DATE1', E2='2007-10-01'. 
 
CVS reader output:
 
"key1","value1","value2","value3","date1","date2"
"key2","1","11.11","111.111","39356","39387"
"key3","2","22","2222.2220000000002","39356","39387"
"key4","-33","-33","-33333.332999999999","39356","39387"
"","","","","",""
WorkItem.Summary: Date format not honored in CSV writer

Comments.Message: Feature has been implemented in CSV and HTML writers.
